intro: Pterocyclus rivulorum, commonly known as the river waterplant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers that are often borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist environments, such as along riverbanks and in wetlands, and is often found in shallow water or damp soil. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
